page.title: 01The village of Covehithe
page.content: A small cluster of houses round the wins of a large medieval church. Within the wins stands a small that ched church built in 1672 and still in use though the population is now only 36 souls. The land is arable and marsh and the population is largely involved in farming. There are also two game-keepers. The sea is eroding the coast here at the rate off approximately 10 metres each year and is assumed that the houses wind the church and the church itself will all be taken in the next 75 years. The marshes are a haven for wild-fowl, marsh barriers and bittern and the reeds are are cut for thatching. All the land and houses are in the ownership of one family as they have been for over 230 years.
